body_html:
@peterjc123 #3757 only adds a hack for Windows, right?

If you're also referring to the problem of using obsolete includes, for a proper fix, I think, one should try to figure out how to place pytorch headers before system headers. At least that is the problem in #3669, confirmed by preprocessor outputs with -E flag passed to NVCC
body_text:
@peterjc123 #3757 only adds a hack for Windows, right?
If you're also referring to the problem of using obsolete includes, for a proper fix, I think, one should try to figure out how to place pytorch headers before system headers. At least that is the problem in #3669, confirmed by preprocessor outputs with -E flag passed to NVCC
body:
@peterjc123 https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/pull/3757 only adds a hack for Windows, right?

If you're also referring to the problem of using obsolete includes, for a proper fix, I think, one should try to figure out how to place pytorch headers before system headers. At least that is the problem in https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/3669, confirmed by preprocessor outputs with `-E` flag passed to NVCC
